resources.string:
I have read and understood

Terms of Service and

Privacy Policy
To continue, please check all boxes
Users who linked Ringoid accounts to the following phone numbers can\'t see my photos, like or message me
Only your match can message first
Inappropriate content, sexually explicit, nudity, pornography
They won\'t be able to see your photos, like or message you.
Ringoid users of the opposite sex
Only users whom photos I liked
Who can see how many times your photos were liked?
Who can see who liked you?
Can search engines find and index your photos?
Who can see your phone number?
Who can find your profile by your phone number?
Who can see which photos you liked?
Who can see which photos you reported?
Don\'t show my photos to Ringoid users, and don\'t allow them to like or message me if they are closer than
You will need to have access to your phone number to sign in. You won\'t be able to return to your account in any other way.
Your profile will be deactivated and your photos will be hidden from everyone immediately so no one can see your photos, like or message you.
If you don\'t sign in within 30 days then your account and data will be deleted permanently.\n\nYou will lose all likes that your photos received.
If you just want to hide your photos from everyone, you can do it in Settings.
You just got a new match
Your match sent you a new message
Can people who didn\'t register their phone numbers get access to your photos in Ringoid?
Can Ringoid users of the same sex discover your profile and browse your photos?
Who can sign in into your account without access to your phone number?
Who can see your current location?
Who can see distance between you and others?
Who can see your location history?
Who can see your year of birth?
Who can see which profiles you blocked?
Who can see when and how often you use Ringoid?
I am of legal age and adult, as defined by the country or state from where I am accessing Ringoid app
Enter the code that was sent to
Who can send photos in a chat?
Who can see that you read messages?
Who can see when you have sent messages?
Who can see that you are online?
Who can see when you were online last time?

+%s %s looks invalid.

Most likely we won't be able to send SMS with a verification code to validate it.

Do you still want to proceed?
No one. Users can see that you liked them and the total number of likes for each photo but not who liked which photo(s).
Who can see which photos you liked and then unliked?
Who can see which photos you viewed?
Who can see how many times you viewed photos?
Who receives a notification that you viewed their profile?
A person with whom I matched or me. After I sent emoji to my match, I allow them to reply with text messages
Who can make screenshots of your messages?
No one. Users with smartphones that run Android version 5.0 and higher can\'t make screenshots in Ringoid (except screenshots of their own photos and Settings).
Who can discover your photos if your face looks similar to someone\'s else?
No one. Ringoid doesn\'t allow lookalike or face search, or reverse image search.
Who can see how popular you are in your area?
No one. Only you can see how many likes your photos received.
Who can see that you bumped into other users?
Who can see your activity history?
Who can copy your text messages to the clipboard from a chat?
Who can paste a text message from the clipboard in order to send it to you in a chat?
Who can download your photos in Ringoid?
Who can share your profile via Ringoid?
Who can make screenshots of your photos displayed in Who Liked You, Messages and New Faces?
No one. Users with smartphones that run Android version 5.0 and higher can\'t make screenshots in Ringoid (except screenshots of their own photos and Settings).
Who can see how many phone numbers you blacklisted?
Who can migrate your account to different phone number?
No one. Due to security reasons, Ringoid customer support won\'t be able to recover your account if you can\'t access your phone number, and doesn\'t migrate an account to a different phone number.
Who can see what phone numbers you blacklisted?
How many Ringoid apps linked to your phone number can run concurrently?
Only one. The most recent sign in will take over, and all other sessions will be signed out automatically.
Who can recover messages after you delete history, block a user, sign out, reinstall the app or delete account?
No one. There is no way to recover messages because the server doesn\'t store them in the database after they are delivered to apps.
You can like different photos of the same user so your profile will rise higher in their Messages.\n\nTo unlike, tap on the heart icon in the corner
You can like different photos of the same user so your profile will rise higher in their Who Liked You. \n\n To unlike, tap on the heart icon in the corner
Privacy: Who can see your photos?\n%s

Only you can see how many likes your photos received.

The more likes you have, the higher your popularity ranking in your area and the more people of the opposite sex can discover you.

You can't see who liked what photo(s) but you can see who liked you.

Photos with more likes are shown first.
You can swipe photos left and right in a carousel.\n\nTo see different profiles, scroll up and down

You can see here photos of people who liked you.

* Swipe photos left and right
* Scroll profiles up and down
* Tap anywhere to like a photo
* To unlike, tap on the heart icon

As soon as you liked them, their profile will move to Messages, and you can text each other.

You can like different photos of the same user so your profile will rise higher in their Messages and they can notice you sooner.

Here you can discover people which you have not seen yet, sorted by distance and popularity (likes).

* Swipe photos left and right
* Scroll profiles up and down
* Tap anywhere to like a photo
* To unlike, tap on the heart icon

If they like you too, it will be a match and you can message each other.

You can like different photos of the same user so your profile will rise higher in their Who Liked You and they can notice you sooner.
Only you can see your photos

Others can\'t see your photos, like or message you. It is almost like you deleted your account, although you can still see Who Liked You already and browse New Faces.\n\nYou can change who can see your photos in Privacy, and allow others to see your photos, like and message you.
Human or sex trafficking, criminal activity
5-7 last messages will be forwarded to Ringoid support

Dear Data Protection Officer,

My Customer ID is %s
Reset my app settings to default

We are relying on your explicit consent to process your personal data (such as your phone number, year of birth, sex, and photos), to transfer your data outside the European Economic Area (EEA), and for the app to report crashes and its usage.

You can withdraw your consent at any time. 

If you withdraw your consent, we won't be able to provide you with services and your account will have to be deleted.
Upload your photos so users can like and message you
This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
You will lose %d likes. Since your popularity ranking will decrease, users of the opposite sex may have less chances of discovering you.\n\n
You can later on upload new photos to allow users to like and message you.

After you upload your photo, you can like others.

If they like you too, it's a match, and you can message each other.

You will need to grant permission for the app to access your photo gallery.
